$ZIM Container freight rate is a function of supply and demand.
SUPPLY = available containers and ships to move them.
DEMAND = goods to stuff into the containers.
SUPPLY got choked by bottlenecks at the ports.  DEMAND stayed steady so rates increased.
Choke is loosening --> increased SUPPLY.  DEMAND plateaud at high levels so rates decreased
China lockdown --> less goods produced (drop in DEMAND) --> increase in SUPPLY (less containers needed) --> rates decrease.
$ZIM dividend craziness notwithstanding
